alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, Warrington, Gulf Breeze, Oriole Beach, Navarre, Perdido Beach, Navarre Beach, Garcon Point, Woodlawn Beach, Beach Haven, Pine Bluff, Holley, Pleasant Grove, Millview, Harper, Broxson, Quinavista, Seaglades, Chanticleer and Paradise Beach.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
